alert.note: Alert for Pend Oreille (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 9:41PM PDT until May 09 at 11:30AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Widespread Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner and Boundary. Portions of Northeast Washington, including the following county, Pend Oreille. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall amounts of 0.50" to 1.00 inches have been reported today with another 0.50" to 1.00" inches possible through Saturday. This could lead to widespread flooding in low-lying areas and along small streams and creeks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
